titleStmt.title: J. F. Hawkins et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4405

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Excellensy Thomas E Bramlette
Governor of the State of Kentucky

The undersigned petitioners citizens of owen County ^living at new Liberty & vicinity^ would respectfully represent to your Ecxcilancy that at the November term 1863 of the Owen Circuit Court three judgments of two hundred Dollars each were rendered against Lewis Krutz ^living at new Liberty^ under indictments for suffering gambling upon his premises
Your petitioners would further represent that said Lewis Krutz is a clever good natured man & we believe that he was ^has been^ frequently imposed upon by men in the habit of playing cards for money

We would also represent that said Krutz is a good citizen & a poor man & has a large family of small children dependent upon him for daily suport & if he is compelled to pay the aforesaid judgments his family will suffer great inconvenience & hardship Your petitioners believe it would be an act of justice on the part of your Excelency to remit the aforesaid fines will We also believe that the fees of the officers of the court will be a sufficient penalty & that said Krutz will here after prohibit gambling upon his premises. All of which is respectfully submitted

Grand Jurors
J F. Hawkins foreman Grand ^jury^
